intro: Cleretum puberulum, commonly known as the hairy cleretum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Cleretum puberulum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes.
